answers.title: an AI-powered assistant to capture, track, and convert cold-chain leads.
answers.goal: Reduce lost leads and speed up quote generation by at least 30% in 6 months.
answers.audience: Primary: Marco and his sales/admin staff  Secondary: Dalucon’s potential clients who interact via WhatsApp/LinkedIn/email  Current workflow = WhatsApp messages + Excel quotes + manual reminders.
answers.inputs:
WhatsApp messages from prospects

LinkedIn inquiries / referrals

Emails (PDF specs, requests)

Excel-based quoting system

Contact details stored in Marco’s phone and email inbox
answers.outputs:
Auto-generated draft quotes (ready for human approval)

Central dashboard of all leads (status: new, quoted, won, lost)

Reminders for follow-ups

Monthly pipeline report (deals in progress + conversion rates)
answers.must_haves:
WhatsApp → lead capture into dashboard

Auto-draft quotes from templates

Simple dashboard view of all active leads
answers.nice_to_haves:
AI-generated LinkedIn messages to prospects

Voice-to-quote (speak into WhatsApp, bot turns it into a quote draft)

Mobile-friendly dashboard app
answers.integrations: WhatsApp Business API  Email (Outlook/Gmail)  Excel → automated quoting template  Optional CRM sync (HubSpot free tier or Supabase database)
answers.constraints:
Budget-conscious SME (no enterprise software fees)

Staff are non-technical → UX must be dead simple

Timeline tight: needs working prototype in 3 months

Compliance: must handle customer data securely (POPIA in SA)
answers.success:
80% of leads automatically captured (no manual entry)

Quote turnaround time drops from 3 days → 1 day

At least 10 new deals closed per month

User adoption: Marco’s staff actually use dashboard daily
answers.team: Marco – project sponsor / end-user  Christo – project driver / client liaison  Milk Roads AI team – design & build  Johan (legacy coder influence) – inspiration for architecture  AI bot (Leads Bot) – execution
answers.timeline: Month 1: Prototype lead capture + dashboard (basic)  Month 2: Quote generation integration (Excel + AI drafts)  Month 3: Pilot test with Dalucon staff → feedback loop  Month 4+: Scale + add LinkedIn + reporting
answers.risks:
Risk: Staff don’t adopt dashboard → Mitigation: keep UI dead simple, provide WhatsApp-first flow

Risk: WhatsApp API too costly/complex → Mitigation: start with manual import, upgrade later

Risk: Quotes inaccurate → Mitigation: human review step before sending to client

answers.goal: “WhatsApp bot that saves leads to Supabase and emails a daily report.”)
